definition: to excavate/to explore/(fig.) to unearth/to tap into
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: The Keqiutou site (NP) excavated in Fujian.
Arnesen has been given the role of head talent scout, in charge of uncovering football talents.
sentences.chinese: 阿内森被任命为球探总管，负责发掘足球天才。

sentences.english: Then, they will find a way to search and know that person well.
sentences.chinese: 然后，探秘将会找到能更好发掘和了解的道路。

sentences.english: In this paper, we analyze and summarize Lü Zuqian's learning psychology.
sentences.chinese: 本文对吕祖谦的学习心理思想进行了发掘和整理。

sentences.english: Nevertheless, to quiet public opinion an exhumation order was granted.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要平定公众意见就必须准许尸体发掘的工作。

sentences.english: The excavation of the necropolis has prominent academic meanings.
sentences.chinese: 这批土墩墓的发掘具有重要的学术意义。

sentences.english: We found the bones of these animals.
sentences.chinese: 我们发掘了这些动物的骨头。

sentences.english: Recent excavations have revealed two main Neolithic cultures lying in stratified sequence.
sentences.chinese: 近年的考古发掘，主要显示两个新石器时代的文化层。

sentences.english: The studio has great potential to tap its visual resource.
sentences.chinese: 可以说，新影的影像资料具有极大的发掘潜力。

sentences.english: It is the first imperial mausoleum excavated on the approval of the State Council.
sentences.chinese: 是第一座由国务院批准有计划发掘的皇陵。

sentences.english: Warriors in array the excavations opening up to the world and sensation.
sentences.chinese: 俑阵经发掘对外开放后便轰动世界。

sentences.english: Then I decided to v14)cultivate his talent.
sentences.chinese: 父亲说，“于是我决定发掘培养他的这种天赋。”

sentences.english: Landor's challenge was to identify the elements relevant for the Chinese pack.
sentences.chinese: 郎涛的挑战就是发掘和中国包装相关的元素。

sentences.english: It's a very new technology so nobody has picked it up and commercialised it.
sentences.chinese: 这是一项非常新的技术，还未被完全发掘并商业化。

sentences.english: Archaeological discovery has shown that Beijing is a cradle of the Chinese nation.
sentences.chinese: 考古发掘表明，北京是中华民族的发源地之一。

sentences.english: To avoid monotony, we must always find something fresh, new.
sentences.chinese: 为了避免千篇一律，我们必须发掘新意。

definition: to excavate/to dig out/fig. to investigate (in an archive)
to explore/to survey/to prospect (for oil etc)/prospecting
to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to investigate/to delve/to probe/to enquire into/to look into
research/a study/CL:項|项[xiang4]/to research/to look into
